intro: Dipteranthus linearisepalus, commonly known as the slender-leaf dipteranthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae, which includes many tropical trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
